title: Skyblivion Is Delayed To 2026, But It Already Looks Very Good
description: The dream of Skyblivion goes back over a decade as a team of fans came together to use The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim's engine to fully recreate and re-imagine Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion as a modern RPG. At the beginning of 2023, the team set a 2025 premiere for Skyblivion. However, that's no longer the plan and Skyblivion has been pushed to next year. The good news is that the latest dev video shows off how much has been finished and what remains to be done. Skyblivion lead Rebelzize narrates the video as he offers a guide to where things stand. According to Rebelzize, most of the work has already been done and over 70 volunteer contributors are still hard at work trying to get the ambitious mod across the finish line. When this project was started, The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion was far out of date. Earlier this year, Bethesda released Oblivion Remastered, which could have taken the wind out of this team's project. Instead, Rebelzize and others praised the remaster as a "win-win" for the community. In recognition for their work, Bethesda gave copies of Oblivion Remastered to the entire Skyblivion mod team. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Silicon Power 1TB MicroSD Express For Switch 2 Drops To $154 At Amazon
description: Samsung P9 512GB microSD Express Card $75 (was $100) | Limited-time deal See at Amazon Silicon Power 1TB microSD Express Card $154 (was $220) with coupon See at Amazon Amazon has brought back one of its most popular Black Friday/Cyber Monday storage deals on December 3. The Samsung P9 512GB microSD Express Card for Nintendo Switch 2 is on sale for $75 (was $100). This is marked as a limited-time deal, but it's unclear when the price will climb back to $100. But if you're looking for a deal on a 1TB Express, you're in luck: The Silicon Power 1TB microSD Express is available for $154 (was $220) when you click the coupon box on Amazon's store page. The 512GB edition is also 30% off, but Amazon's stock is running low. These are the lowest prices we've seen at Amazon for 512GB and 1TB Express Cards. Samsung P9 512GB microSD Express -- $75 ($100) Silicon Power 1TB microSD Express -- $154 ($220) with coupon Silicon Power 512GB microSD Express -- $72.77 ($110) with coupon Amazon has also restocked the Switch 2 Mario Kart bundle and is matching Walmart's deal price of $449 (was $500). If you pick up the Mario Kart bundle and need a carrying case, Amazon has deals on several officially licensed travel cases, including one that's themed around Metroid Prime 4: Beyond. Nintendo Switch 2 + Mario Kart World Bundle $449 (was $500) See at Amazon See at Walmart Expand Nintendo Switch 2 Storage with microSD Express Cards microSD Express Cards for Nintendo Switch 2 microSD Express Cards for Nintendo Switch 2 Check out all of the notable options as of November 2025. See at Amazon Best microSD Express Cards at Amazon Below, we've listed every microSD Express Card from a reputable brand we could find on Amazon--though we excluded cards with prices that are substantially higher than average. The Switch 2 is the first major consumer device to use the ultra-fast storage format, so the market is understandably limited. That said, the number of options has doubled multiple times over since Nintendo announced the Switch 2 requires microSD Express to expand storage. Continue Reading at GameSpot

"Step into a warped vision of Menendez's Nicaraguan compound, now twisted beyond recognition: colossal machetes carve through the sky, and shattered pieces of reality hang suspended as if time itself has splintered," reads a line from the description. title: Nintendo Switch 2 Mario Kart Bundle Restocked With $50 Discount At Amazon (December 3)
description: Nintendo Switch 2 + Mario Kart World Bundle $449 (was $500) See at Amazon See at Walmart Amazon has restocked the Nintendo Switch 2 Mario Kart World bundle and is once again matching Walmart's deal. This promotion could end at any time, but as of December 3 at 12 PM PT, the Switch 2 with Mario Kart World is available for $449 (was $500) at Amazon and Walmart. Best Buy has increased the price back to $500, and Target sold out on Cyber Monday. Discounts on Nintendo consoles are rare in general, but it's genuinely shocking to see a deal on the Switch 2 less than six months after launch. The $51 discount will show up after you add the bundle to your cart at Walmart. Nintendo Switch 2 + Mario Kart World Bundle $449 (was $500) The Mario Kart World console bundle is valued at $530, so you're essentially getting a copy of the Switch 2 exclusive for free. The bundle includes a voucher that can be redeemed on the Switch 2 eShop for the digital edition of Mario Kart World. Here's what's included inside the box: Switch 2 with 7.9-inch LCD display Joy-Con 2: Left and Right Joy-Con 2 Straps Joy-Con 2 Grip Dock for TV Mode Ultra High-Speed HDMI Cable USB-C Cable 60W AC adapter Voucher for Mario Kart World The Mario Kart bundle is selling for the same price as the Switch 2 console on its own. Nintendo previously stated the Mario Kart bundle would only be available until Fall 2025, so Amazon and Walmart might be clearing out their remaining units before the bundle disappears for good. See at Amazon See at Walmart The Switch 2 has 256GB of onboard storage, but you can expand it with a microSD Express Card. Amazon has limited time deals on Samsung's P9 512GB microSD Express and Silicon Power's 1TB microSD Express. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Call Of Duty Mobile Season 11 Adds A Cool Crossover You Won't Find In Black Ops 7
description: Call of Duty Mobile is celebrating the game's sixth anniversary with plenty of new content. While Black Ops 7 is sticking to thematically appropriate operator skins, Season 11 of Call of Duty Mobile includes a major crossover with Street Fighter, which allows players to transform into the popular fighting characters and use their iconic fighting moves. This new season also adds a DMZ extraction mode, new loadout items to unlock, and special events. Table of Contents [hide] Season 11 start date details Battle pass details Season 11 start date details Season 11 starts on December 11 at 12 PM PT / 3 PM ET. This new season includes a brand-new battle pass with both free and premium items. Battle pass details The main highlights of the free battle-pass tiers are the SO-14 marksman rifle and Wheelson-HS scorestreak. There are also weapon blueprints, skins, and other cosmetics available to unlock for free. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Game With Amazing Premise Has Been Canceled
description: Legendary game designer and programmer Ron Gilbert (Monkey Island) has revealed that one of his exciting-sounding upcoming projects has been canceled due in part to investors not coming to the table to fund the project. Speaking to Ars Technica, Gilbert said this game had a vision of being a "large, open-world-type RPG" in the vein of The Legend of Zelda. Gilbert worked alongside two other people--an artist and a designer--for about a year on the project before Gilbert realized it was not going to happen. "I just [didn't] have the money or the time to build a big open-world game like that," he said. "You know, it's either a passion project you spent 10 years on, or you just need a bunch of money to be able to hire people and resources." Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Evercade Street Fighter & Mega Man Cartridge-Based Arcades Finally Back In Stock At Amazon
description: Evercade Alpha Bartop Arcade - Street Fighter Edition $280 See at Amazon Evercade Alpha Bartop Arcade - Mega Man Edition $280 See at Amazon The Mega Man and Street Fighter editions of the Evercade Alpha Bartop Arcade are back in stock at Amazon after being sold out in the US practically all year. The restock arrives just one week after Blaze Entertainment launched the new Taito edition in the US. Officially licensed by Capcom, the Street Fighter and Mega Man countertop cabinets launched last November and then disappeared from Amazon in early 2025. All three Alpha Bartop Arcades retail for $280 and are shipped/sold by Solutions 2 Go, which is now the official distributor for the Alpha in the US. The Taito edition is temporarily out of stock at Amazon. The two Evercade Alpha Capcom editions have six preloaded games each, while the Taito edition has 10 games. These cartridge-based countertop arcade machines support Evercade's expansive catalog of retro game collections. Over a dozen additional digital games can be unlocked in the Evercade OS Secret menu. Heads up: Amazon has limited-time deals on over a dozen Evercade cartridges, but these deals end December 4 at 12 AM PT. Amazon's deals on the Super Pocket retro handhelds end tonight, too. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Metroid Prime 4: Beyond Players, Be Sure To Do This Before Entering Endgame
description: Getting 100% completion in a Metroid game--and metroidvania titles in general--is a satisfying achievement that's part of the genre's appeal. However, in Metroid Prime 4: Beyond, there is unfortunately a way to pigeonhole yourself where collecting everything needed isn't possible. Now, the game will warn you about a point of no return, but it's still easy to make a regrettable decision. That's why GameSpot's reviewer for the first-person adventure, Steve Watts, advises players to make a copy of their main save in another save slot before entering the endgame. Watts detailed the "confusing choice" that Nintendo and developer Retro Studios made in his Metroid Prime 4 review. "When I was ready to proceed to the endgame, I got the usual warnings about a point of no return, but I had figured I could always load an older save to go back and do more exploring to pick up power-ups that I missed," Watts wrote. "But the auto-save now has me locked into the final area with no such apparent option, and my regular save slot--the one that activates when Samus steps into a save station--has been overwritten with a Mission Complete, so loading it prompts me to start a new game." Continue Reading at GameSpot
